snippet: As violence flared in southeastern Ukraine, the president repeated his allegation that thousands of Russian forces had crossed the border to help separatists.
abstract: Focus in Ukraine conflict has shifted from Donetsk airport to border checkpoint northwest of Luhansk amid reports of attacks by Russian troops there; Russia has denied sending fighters to area; Kiev government tightens borders between its territory and that controlled by separatists in country's east.

byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Melissa Eddy from Berlin; Andrew Roth from Moscow; Alison Smale from Davos, Switzerland; and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: As violence flared in southeastern Ukraine, the president repeated his allegation that thousands of Russian forces had crossed the border to help separatists.

headline.main: Battle Rages With Rebels at Border Post in Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Battle Rages With Rebels at Border Post in Ukraine
